Title: Specialist, Retail Logistics Operations
RoleDescription:
Logistics & Inventory Operations, Specialist
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
The entry rate for this role is $20/hr. 
Overview:As a Logistics & Inventory Operations Specialist, youll play a vital role in keeping Wayfairs Physical Retail operations running smoothly as we redefine the customer shopping experience. Your work, from managing inventory flow and conducting audits to processing shipments and resolving discrepancies, directly supports an exceptional, seamless experience for our customers. 
With a sharp eye for detail and a proactive problem-solving mindset, youll focus on inventory accuracy, exception management, and operational efficiency. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, partners effectively across teams, and takes ownership in building a flawless operational foundation that reflects Wayfairs commitment to retail excellence and a top-tier customer experience.
What Does a Logistics & Inventory Specialist Do?

 Demonstrates Reliability: Be present and punctual for every shift to ensure were ready to support customers when it matters most. Communicate proactively about any unexpected events or issues.
 Ensure Inventory Accuracy: Conduct daily audits and maintain a robust Cycle Count Program to protect inventory integrity. Use scanning technology to track carton-level details such as condition, quantity, and location.
 Manage Inventory Performance: Monitor aging inventory, process markdowns, execute damage write-offs, and handle vendor returns for recalls, dead stock, and overstock. Use your inventory or e-commerce experience to optimize processes.
 Receive and Process Shipments: Unload and receive inventory carefully, including manual handling of large and heavy items. Record overages, shortages, and damages accurately.
 Proactively Monitor Systems: Utilize order management tools and Warehouse Management Software to track inventory flow, resolve discrepancies, and keep records current. Regularly review Cycle Count data in Google Sheets to spot and fix gaps.
 Audit Operations: Perform regular and trigger-based audits on inbound and outbound shipments to ensure accurate processing and shipping.
 Support Operational Excellence: Use ticketing systems to manage exceptions and resolve issues. Provide feedback on tools and processes to improve efficiency based on your frontline experience.
 Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with logistics leaders and other departments to streamline operations and maintain Wayfairs high standards of operational excellence.
 Adapt and Problem-Solve: Own inventory challenges, drive solutions, and ensure smooth coordination between warehouse and retail teams in a fast-moving environment.

 
Youll Thrive in This Role if You Have:

 Education: High School Diploma or equivalent is required.
 Inventory Control Experience: 1 to 3 years of inventory control experience, preferably in retail.
 Distribution or Logistics Experience: 1+ year in distribution or logistics is preferred.
 Open Schedule Availability: Flexibility to work nights, weekends, and holidays as business needs require.
 Customer Service Skills: Strong communication skills and ability to stay calm and professional under pressure.
 Adaptability and Problem-Solving: Comfortable with evolving tools, systems, and processes, and able to take initiative to maintain operational excellence.
 Technical Proficiency: Strong skills with Microsoft Office or Google Suite preferred.
 Detail Orientation: Highly organized with proven ability to manage complex inventory workflows and systems.

 
Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity:Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

Title: Safety & Security Supervisor
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $65,340.00-$71,775  per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Wayfair Security and SupervisorLocation: Port Wentworth, GA
Safety & Security Supervisor
Overview
The Wayfair Global Safety and Security (GLOSS) team is a multifunctional team that prioritizes mitigating risk by protecting our assets, intelligence collection, collaborative process improvements, and continuously evolving our culture through an inclusive approach to health and safety. We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because we are driven, determined and relentless about taking care of our people in a fast-paced environment. This is an incredible and unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing eCommerce company.
The Safety and Security Site Supervisor will be responsible for providing leadership on all life safety and security related standards, systems, processes, while driving our safety and security initiatives across the supply chain network. This role reports to the Supply Chain Safety and Security Manager and will be responsible for providing leadership with options, recommendations, and best practices as a subject matter expert in safety and security.
 
What Youll Do


Partner with operations to ensure the implementation and adherence of all aspects of our Injury and Illness Prevention Plan for assigned location(s).


Partner with the Global Safety and Security Business Support and Compliance Teams to support operations in executing Global Safety and Security initiatives.


Escalate requested changes and best practices to the Safety Compliance Team for review and standardization.


Anticipate, identify, evaluate hazardous conditions and build practices to aid in all critical incident planning, preparation, and responses.


Conduct inspections of facilities to identify and correct potential hazards, security risks, and ensure regulatory compliance.


Partner cross-functionally with all levels of site management in assigned location(s) to mitigate risk and resolve safety and security related issues.


Partner with site leadership in developing action plans to improve safety/security culture in assigned location(s) and promote employee engagement in safety/security programs.


Partner with operations and key stakeholders, to ensure all new hires receive safety orientation, and verify annual training requirements for existing employees.


Assist in the implementation and execution of safety and security accountability programs.


Maintain effective working relationships with regulatory agencies, industry security and life safety professionals, vendors, and suppliers.


Prepare and submit security incident reports in compliance with company and insurance carrier requirements. Support any related investigations.


Provide daily guidance to the third-party guard service. Ensure guards are following documented post orders. Work to ensure there are no gaps in guard coverage.


Conduct physical security, camera system, and access control checks to ensure compliance.


 
What Youll Need


2+ years in a dedicated Safety/Security role or similar experience required. Bachelors Degree not required but preferred.


Lean Six-Sigma experience desired.


OSHA 10 or OSHA 30 Certification, preferred.


Demonstrated knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements that govern worker health and safety, physical assessment and ergonomic skills, and case management skills.


Knowledge of local, state, and federal fire and safety regulations and laws.


Demonstrated working knowledge of safety and security concepts, best practices, policies, programs, and procedures. Preferably in a retail distribution environment.


Ability to handle multiple projects, set priorities, strong organizational and time management skills.


Flexibility to support multiple buildings across multiple shifts that are dynamic and have changing business needs.


Excellent analytical and organizational skills, and demonstrated experience with hypothesis-driven learning and turning data into actionable insights.


Superior communication skills with the ability to navigate a complex organization and generate buy-in for ideas and plans.


Entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for action and ability to deal with extreme ambiguity and rapidly changing environments.


Strong reputation for honesty, integrity, and professionalism, including an ability to maintain confidentiality.


Must be able to stand and/or walk in a variety of weather and terrain conditions for shifts up to 10 hours.


Must be able to lift and hold 15 pounds.


Be able to work effectively in warehouse environments with hot and cold conditions, as well as loud noises.


Ability to travel within your assigned area of responsibility. Occasional (10%) overnight travel is required.


This is an onsite role with 40 hours that vary across multiple shifts as the needs of the business change to operational requirements.


In this role, one will drive positive change through collaboration with other management members. Working closely with operations management, this person will communicate, train, and coach safe work behaviors that align with Wayfairs safety policies and security protocols. Additionally, this person will oversee third-party security guards to ensure they meet performance standards. The primary focus will be on assessing, reducing, and eliminating risks, as well as mitigating threats to our people, company, and assets.


GLOSS serves as a support function focused on upholding and enhancing our reputation as a "great place to work" by ensuring a safe and secure work environment. The work we do directly impacts this reputation. Reducing injuries and incidents not only fosters a positive culture but also leads to substantial cost savings for our organization, as diligent efforts to prevent safety and security-related issues help avoid associated expenses.


This individual will engage with various levels of management and interact with hundreds of warehouse associates, though there will be no direct reports. This position is unique within the building, with no other similar roles. This person will report to the GLOSS Regional Field Manager and will be part of a team of 4-7 members.


Previous Safety Experience: Prior experience in safety roles at Amazon & Target would be great-to-haves.


Please put Safety as the priority in this search.


Would be for one of the campus in Perris CA1 Large Parcel.


Software Proficiency: Experience with Gensuite and InfoLink software is preferred, but not mandatory.


OSHA Standards Knowledge: Familiarity with OSHA standards and regulations is required.


Powered Industrial Vehicle Expertise: Experience with powered industrial vehicle operation, training, and safety oversight is needed.


Fulfillment/Distribution Center Background: Experience working in a fulfillment or distribution center is important.


Security Experience: While security-related experience is a plus, it can be taught. Prioritize candidates with a strong safety background.

You'll be more than a salesperson; youll be a trusted design partner, guiding customers through everything from furniture selections to full-room transformations. RoleDescription:
This hybrid position will be based in our Boston office Monday- Thursday, with remote flexibility on Fridays.
We are Wayfair. We deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. We are looking for a talented GSOC analyst to join our newly formed Global Corporate Security Team. This is an incredible and unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing eCommerce company and to help build a department from the ground up  your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!
The GSOC analyst will be responsible for the daily operations of the GSOC and providing support to applicable stakeholders in the event of an incident or crisis.  This individual will be part of a dynamic corporate security team whose mission is to provide world class support to our partners. This person will work on building and expanding the GSOC to 24/7 operations in the future and supporting the Corporate Security Team at Wayfair. This person will report to the GSOC Supervisor.

Perform daily functions of the GSOC by monitoring alarms, access control, CCTV, and key events that may impact Wayfairs operations and assets, providing periodic and timely reports.
Review, analyze, and escalate issues to help mitigate global threats to Wayfairs employees, property, and partners.

Evaluate and improve the structure and impact of internal reporting products to align with leadership needs.
Dispatch and coordinate responses to incidents or crisis events that occur or could potentially impact Wayfairs operations.
Maintain detailed records of communications and events, including incident tracking and case management.
Manage and handle sensitive incidents while maintaining confidentiality.
Collaborate with global partners to identify security risks and develop mitigation strategies.

2+ years of experience working in a security function, preferably in an operations or control center setting (either government or private sector).
Bachelors Degree preferred.
Ability to multitask in a fast-paced work environment, think through problems, and make sound decisions under pressure.
Must have the ability to communicate both written and orally with applicable stakeholders and represent Wayfair to external parties such as law enforcement.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Strong decision-making ability during both crisis and non-crisis situations.
Ability to work in a flexible scheduling environment and support 24/7 operation as needed.

Summer 2025 Start

This team works directly with suppliers, vendors, and customers to provide new levels of efficiency and performance. They also interact internally with Product, Engineering, and Business Intelligence teams to generate the core analytical insights that enable Wayfair to tackle transportation, warehousing, and delivery challenges. Manage processes and drive engagement with key cross-functional partners
Leverage analytical methods and visualization to translate data sets into actionable insights to drive business decisions and outcomes
Conduct ad hoc analyses and build reporting in Google Sheets
Communicate regularly with cross functional partners to understand the health of Wayfairs supply chain network and determine ways to break down problems into action-oriented solutions
Develop and drive adherence to sustainable long-term performance management frameworks to improve performance across multiple process paths in our supply chain
Monitor key performance indicators and assess how were making progress against our core metrics and OKRs
Work cross-functionally with a variety of teams including Warehousing, Transportation, Technology, and Supplier facing teams.
Willingness to travel 2550% of the time for business needs.

1-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience.
Experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
Authorization to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
Familiarity with any programming language (R, Python) is a plus, including motivation to learn and develop the skill-set
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills: excited about working with and synthesizing big data into actionable insights; comfortable using data software to conduct analyses and synthesize findings

High attention to detail, zero-defect analysis and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously

RoleDescription:
Senior Analyst - B2B Marketing London, UK | Office-Based (MonThurs, Fri-WFH) Full-Time
 Benefits: Wayfair Employee Discount, Private Medical Care, Dental Care, Gym Membership Reimbursement, Tuition Reimbursement, 25 Days Starting Holiday + Bank Holidays (with tenure increases), Pension, Cycle to Work scheme, and more.
 Wayfair & The Role
Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of millions of items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares and more. Committed to delighting its customers every step of the way, Wayfair is reinventing the way people shop for their homes - from product discovery to final delivery.We are looking for a Senior Analyst  B2B Marketing with 3+ years of experience to manage and optimize our B2B marketing activities (i.e. Paid Search, Email marketing). This role is perfect for a data-driven professional with strong analytical and technical skills, capable of executing and leading initiatives to drive growth.
You will work closely with internal teams (Marketing channels, Category Management, Martech, Data Science, Engineering) to enhance performance and drive efficiency. The ideal candidate has experience with B2B marketing, bidding strategies, audience segmentation, and attribution modeling while understanding what B2B customers need to further tailor and optimize our B2B marketing activities.
 What You'll Do


Manage and optimize B2B marketing activities across various marketing channels (i.e. Paid Search, email) ensuring alignment with business objectives.


Analyze, identify and prioritize the most promising acquisition and brand growth levers, based on data and market trends


Build and scale user acquisition strategies across all marketing areas such as influencers, content, brand activations, partnerships, and more

Drive deep analysis of our acquisition funnels, user behavior, and LTV:CAC dynamics to spot opportunities and optimize ROI

Manage cross functional projects to further drive growth of our B2B customer base


Work with Data Science and Martech teams to refine machine learning-based bidding strategies, automation, and attribution models.

Stay ahead of platform updates, privacy regulations, and measurement changes, including GA4, server-side tracking, and first-party data strategies.

 What Youll Bring


3+ years of experience in B2B marketing

Strong analytical and technical skills, with experience in Excel (advanced), SQL, Looker, Tableau, Python, or R.

Knowledge of incrementality testing, attribution modeling, and marketing automation.


Strong business acumen, with the ability to translate insights into actionable optimizations.

Bachelors degree in Marketing, Business, Data Analytics, or related field (Masters preferred).

Understanding of the evolving privacy and measurement landscape, including GA4, first-party data, and server-side tracking.

Title: Senior Software Engineering Manager, Web Experiences (Frontend)
RoleDescription:
Software Engineering Manager, Web Experiences (Frontend)
The base pay for this position is $172,500 - $190,000 per year. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
We also need someone who will be working out of our Boston office on a hybrid schedule.
Who We Are:
Storefront Engineering has a unique opportunity to engage directly with our customers. We power the experiences that make shopping for millions of products feel simple, personal, and inspiring - whether someones browsing our mobile app or completing a purchase from their laptop at home.
As Wayfair continues to scale, Storefront Engineering is undergoing a major technology evolution - modernizing our stack and empowering teams to deliver independently, rapidly, and with high quality. Were investing in the tools and infrastructure that allow engineers to move fast, own outcomes, and bring delightful customer experiences to life.
About The Team:
Our Web Experience teams build the most visible parts of Wayfairs customer journey - from landing pages and navigation to product discovery and decision-making. Were a team of engineers working across the stack, with a focus on JavaScript, React and Node.js. We collaborate closely with design, product, and analytics partners to bring elegant, performant, and accessible experiences to life.
We care deeply about web performance, reusability, visual polish, and user experience. We also value experimentation, iterative delivery, and the ability to move quickly without sacrificing quality. This team is a great fit for engineering managers who enjoy empowering developers, partnering cross-functionally, and guiding customers to the perfect product for their home.
What Youll Do:

Lead a team of frontend engineers to build and maintain customer-facing web experiences that are performant, accessible, and delightful.
Set a clear technical vision and drive execution against high-quality outcomes that meet product goals and delivery timelines.
Collaborate cross-functionally with product, design, analytics, and other engineering teams to define priorities, scope work, and align roadmaps.
Grow and support your team through coaching, mentorship, and career development; foster a healthy, inclusive team culture where engineers do their best work.
Balance short-term delivery pressures with long-term technical investments in architecture, maintainability, and performance.
Drive operational excellence by improving quality, site speed, monitoring, reliability, and team processes.
Advocate for modern web development standards, and help evolve Wayfairs frontend architecture, including adoption of React Server Components, streaming, and modular design systems.
Contribute to the broader engineering management community at Wayfair through hiring, onboarding, and cross-team initiatives.
Champion the use of metrics and analytics to inform priorities, measure success, and iterate on customer-facing features.

What Youll Need:

Experience managing frontend engineers delivering production-grade, customer-facing web applications.
Strong technical background in modern frontend technologies (e.g., React, Next.js, GraphQL) with the ability to guide architecture decisions and code when needed.
Demonstrated ability to lead teams toward successful project delivery while balancing scope, quality, and speed.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
A product mindset with a strong focus on user experience and business impact.
Experience working in platform teams or building shared tooling and reusable components is a plus.
A track record of fostering a strong team culture, supporting individual growth, and managing performance.
Comfort operating in ambiguity and leading through change in a fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with web performance metrics (e.g., Core Web Vitals) and a passion for building fast, intuitive, and reliable web interfaces.

Benefits & Perks:

Full health benefits available (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA) on day one for eligible employees.
No-cost access to 2nd.MD, a virtual expert medical consultation and navigation service.
Global Traveler Health Insurance through GeoBlue.
24/7 access to mental, financial, physical and emotional wellbeing support, plus an enhanced offering of therapy and coaching.
Automatic enrollment into Basic Life and Accidental Death & Disability Insurance.
401(k) matching with immediate vesting.
Paid Parental Leave, Surrogacy & Adoption Reimbursement and Caregiver Services.
Tuition Reimbursement.
Wayfair Employee Discount.
Gym/Fitness Discounts (including Peloton, Wellhub and varying regional memberships).
Exclusive access to thousands of perks & discounts through BenefitHub.
Yearly match up to $500 for personal donations made by employees to registered 501(c)(3) nonprofits.

Title: Site Leader
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $137,540-$148,120 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
Site Leader
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customers needs, the Wayfair Fulfillment team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. Weve been busy building a best-in-class fulfillment network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset-based fulfillment centers. We are looking for talented hard-working individuals to join our growing team  your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!
What You'll Do

Develop robust, trusting relationships with key stakeholders and senior leadership, and identify opportunities to improve the fulfillment center operations.
Oversee the overall safety, employee engagement, collaboration, quality, performance and customer experience of the fulfillment center operations
Create and maintain a strong safety culture that continuous seeks to eliminate risks from the operation
Command a strong senior presence, lead and build a team of high performing operations managers & operations supervisors
Drive creation of quality initiatives, process change initiatives and other Lean initiatives to enable their functional area and ultimately the fulfillment center to meet and exceed business plans
Partner closely with a variety of groups company- wide, including transportation, network management, S&OP, data integration, employee engagement, inventory planning, engineering and others to coordinate cross functional projects
Monitor and drive key performance end to end metrics to ensure that we are providing excellent customer experience and delivering on our promise
Contribute to the development of new tools, processes and technology which make our teams more efficient and effective
Support operational strategy and innovation to drive business goals for revenue, operational performance, and profitability
Manage multiple priorities in a face-paced environment with effective communication and thorough follow through
Establish sound process improvement initiatives that drive year over year improvement, as well as streamline and optimize day-to-day operations
Regularly communicate performance trends and improvements to the organization

What You'll Need

5+ years of e-commerce, supply chain, operations, or logistics experience. 
Experience with complex operational, process, and performance improvement projects (lean or six sigma experience highly valued) including process mapping and process re-design
Demonstrated passion and continued focus of safety as a value rather than just a priority
Strong defect reduction, process, manufacturing, or engineering background with an ability to understand work flow and throughput in the operation
Ability to work collaboratively across functions and synthesize multiple points of view into a streamlined action plan
Proven ability as a passionate people-centric leader who can effectively drive results in a fast-paced and rapidly growing company
Able to hit the ground running  a confident, entrepreneurial self-starter with the ability to manage and prioritize projects to delegate tasks appropriately
Demonstrated leadership in building a culture of Continuous Improvement for process and operations
Strong analytical ability necessary to gather and interpret data to further develop, recommend and implement solutions.  
Technologically savvy, collaborative confident leader, familiarity with google suite products a plus
Extremely organized, meticulous and detailed oriented

Title: Business Process Manager- Sales & Customer Service
RoleDescription:
Contract: Full Time/ Remote
Location: Ireland based
Travel: Minimum 50% Global Travel
Elevate BPO Excellence. Forge Global Partnerships. Champion Customer Success.
At Wayfair, we dont just sell home goodswe deliver exceptional experiences. Our award-winning Customer Service & Sales Teams are the heart of that mission, blending cutting-edge technology with genuine human empathy to build trust and loyalty with every interaction. From the moment an order is placed to the delivery at a customers door, were dedicated to making shopping for the home seamless, personal, and enjoyable- via phone, email, chat or social media.
We're looking for dynamic Managers to join our fast-paced, remote environment and help shape the future of customer satisfaction and sales excellence. As a BPO Manager, youll drive positive and impactful partnerships with our Vendors globally, treating every day as an opportunity to to champion our customers, exceed performance targets, and strengthen business growth.
What Youll Do

Manage and execute against a site strategy for your key account / Service Partner effectively delivering KPI / operational improvements through effective governance.  
Be the primary point of contact for your Service Partner region/site, building and maintaining strong relationships that drive high stakeholders satisfaction. 
Provide regular updates and visibility to both wayfair and service partner stakeholders leading WBRs for your site, and providing weekly narrative through weekly email updates. 
Managing on change adoption, assuring that process changes and adherence is effectively tracked and adopted across your service partner site(s) 
Effective and timely escalation of issues that arise which are blocking progress to site strategy or contracted standards. 
Maintain an onsite in person presence by attending on site once a month including all QBRs (this includes global travel to Europe & Asia (this role requires a minimum of 50% travel time) 

What You'll Need

Proven experience in successfully managing a BPO operation, either on the client side or through a third-party provider. Global or multi-regional exposure is highly advantageous.
Demonstrable knowledge of how to effectively manage  and optimize outsourced vendor relationships and drive performance improvements.
Excellent written and verbal communication, assertiveness, and strong relationship building skills. 
Proficient understanding of how, and when, to leverage supporting tools & systems to achieve measurable business improvements
Capability to lead through influence and governance rather than direct management. 
To be a proactive self starter; decisive, and able to quickly pivot and implement improvement opportunities with agility. 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a strong attention to detail and process focused mindset. 
Ability to deliver timely and constructive feedback to both internal and external stakeholders
Intermediate User knowledge of IT systems and Applications (Google Suite/ Microsoft Office).
Flexibility to work effectively across time zones and cultures.

Salary Range
The salary range for this position is 47,000-51,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Title: Junior Merchandiser
RoleDescription:
As a Junior Merchandiser, you will develop, execute and drive assortment strategies for your product class. Your ranges will become our Wayfair Verified items (Wayfairs super set of products that capture our highest % of revenue). You will influence how curated product ranges come to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (print, digital and social), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. You will support strong cross functional relationships to ensure all strategies and goals are achieved, acting as the representative of the customer in strategic decisions on product placement. You will collaborate with Brand Management, Category Management, Marketing, Analytics & Operations, and external Suppliers to ensure the strategic vision is executed all the way to the customer. Leveraging data-driven qualitative and quantitative insights, you'll make a direct impact on overall sales, Wayfair share gains, and empower customers to create a home just right for them. 
 
What you'll do on any given day as a Curated Merchant...
As a Junior Merchandiser, you will be executing against our ambitious goals to shape our future curation strategy.  You will gain a deep understanding of the competitive market for your class. Leveraging this insight to build, curate, and maintain a category assortment strategy for our Wayfair Verified items, developing a shelf space plan and actively managing and iterating our product offering. You will ultimately decide which products will be highlighted and amplified across all marketing channels, with a crisp business justification to support your selection and robust alignment with key stakeholders. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners in Category Management, Promotion Operations, Marketing, Brand, Creative, Merchandising Operations, Analytics and external Suppliers in order to shape and solidify the direction of your class. Ensure your class range is competitive in both product and price.  You will know our customers needs better than anyone else and are constantly thinking about what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.
Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs.
 
What Youll Do 

Build and maintain class assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering
Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points
Partner closely with Category Management, Suppliers, Creative, Marketing, Analytics and Brand to determine how best to bring the selection to life in both digital and print
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities.  Partner with category management and external suppliers when curating the line plan to find products that deliver compelling newness and tomorrows best sellers.
Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.  
Domestic Travel [4x / month] to our QC & Video Studio operation to ensure product experience
International Travel [1-2x / year] Attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers and further optimize our catalog    

 
Who You Are

A bachelor's or masters degree
Experience buying or merchandising trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Strong ability to analyze data and think critically, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business  
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Excellent communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities.  
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company
Ability to work from Wayfairs London office 3 days per week, Wayfairs Verified Studio 1 day per week in Birmingham &  1 day a week per week remote. Travel for competitor diligence & trade shows.

Excellent communication skills across engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders alike.
Passion for leading a large, cross-cutting technical initiative to delivery, cross-functional consensus building and influencing design decisions.

Title: Full-Time Design Advisor for Joss & Main (A Wayfair Specialty Brand)
RoleDescription:
Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring for our Joss & Main retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store  might be the future home for your career.
The base pay for this position is $24.50 per hour.
Overview:
At Wayfair, we believe everyone deserves a home they loveand as a Design Advisor, youll help make that happen. You'll be more than a salesperson; youll be a trusted design partner, guiding customers through everything from furniture selections to full-room transformations. Using your interior design expertise, trend awareness, and flair for customer service, youll help bring their vision to lifewhether in-store, virtually, or in their home.
This role blends creativity and strategy, giving you the tools to inspire and the autonomy to deliver results. From room layouts to fabric swatches, your design solutions will reflect each customers unique style, budget, and needs. Were not just a storewere a community of creators, doers, and dreamers. At Wayfair, youll join a team that cheers each other on, celebrates wins big and small, and knows that building beautiful homes should also be fun.
Ready to help customers fall in love with their homesand your career? Lets make it happen.
What Does A Retail Design Advisor Do?

Be the Customers Trusted Advisor: Greet, listen, and learn. Youll lead design consultations that feel more like conversations, getting to know your customers style, needs, and how they really live. Proven ability to influence and lead teams, with strong communication and mentorship skills.

A track record of delivering high-impact, business-critical systems in a fast-paced environment.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

5+ years of experience architecting highly complex, interconnected systems that solved complex business problems
8+ years of experience in backend software engineering using object oriented language and preferably Java
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience

Experience with  Cloud Native architecture platforms like Google Cloud, AWS, or Azure.

Title: Senior Merchandise Associate
RoleDescription:
AllModern, Senior Merchandise Associate
Specialty Retail Brands (AllModern, Birch Lane, Joss & Main)
Wayfairs Specialty Retail Brands (AllModern, Birch Lane, Joss & Main) target the $60B specialty furniture market and are incremental to Wayfair LLC.  These brands provide a tightly curated assortment of highly stylish and elevated quality products for the style-obsessed specialty customer.  
What You'll Do
In the Senior Merchandise Associate role you will manage a category for one of the Specialty Retail Brands.  As the category expert, you will be responsible for bringing the brand style and vision to life by owning the category assortment and presentation to our customers, as well as collaborating with our supplier partners and internal stakeholders to drive our brand identity across all channels.
Building and maintaining category assortment strategies for Kitchen & Dining; inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering

A strong interest in building a career in buying and/or supplier relationship management

Ability to understand a brand vision, aesthetic, and customer base and how to bring that to life through the product assortment

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal and the ability to influence cross-functionally

Ability to communicate and feel comfortable speaking directly with C-suite level suppliers from large companies

Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects at once; you dont miss the details and can work autonomously and with partners to drive projects and tasks to completion

Title: Senior Manager, Workday HRIS
RoleDescription:
Who We Are [Talent and HRIS Technology]
The Talent / HRIS Platforms team is seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Manager, Workday HRIS to lead the design, development, and delivery of innovative solutions across our HR technology landscape. This role will serve as a liaison between technology and talent / HR business operations  ensuring that Workday and integrated systems are optimized for scale, accuracy, and delivering a world-class employee experience for our 20K Employees worldwide
This individual will combine deep Workday configuration expertise with strong project leadership, stakeholder engagement, and a forward-looking approach to systems strategy and process excellence.
At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN.
 
What Youll Do

Workday & Technology Architecture
Architect end-to-end Workday solutions across modules such as HCM, Compensation, Benefits, Time Tracking & Absence, Payroll, Security, and Reporting.
Own the full Workday configuration lifecycle: requirement gathering, solution design, configuration, testing, deployment, and support.
Lead Workday Core configuration (e.g., locations, cost centers, pay groups, custom orgs, positions management) and enhancements (e.g., time off rules, alerts, business processes).
Develop and support scalable integrations with internal/external systems (e.g., payroll, ATS like Greenhouse, other enterprise platforms).
Perform EIBs, data conversions, and validation activities during implementations or mass updates.
Strategic Project & Stakeholder Management
Lead cross-functional HR technology projects from concept to implementation, ensuring alignment with strategic business goals and user experience standards.
Collaborate with HR, IT, and business stakeholders to evaluate, prioritize, and deliver system enhancements or new capabilities.
Translate complex business needs into scalable technical solutions, identifying dependencies and mitigating risks.
Manage technology intake, roadmap planning, project timelines, and post-launch stabilization.
Governance & Continuous Improvement
Establish and document best practices, standard operating procedures, and configuration governance across the Workday ecosystem.
Perform regular data audits to maintain data integrity and security compliance.
Monitor Workday releases and proactively evaluate opportunities for innovation or process improvement.
Stay informed on emerging HR tech trends, particularly AI/automation, and provide forward-looking recommendations.
Client Focus & Leadership
Serve as the primary point of contact for HR Centers of Excellence and other internal clients regarding system capabilities and reporting.
Resolve inquiries related to employee data, integrations, and configuration impacts.
Coach and mentor junior members of the HRIS/People Tech team as needed.

 
What Youll Need

8+ years of experience in HR systems, with deep Workday expertise across multiple modules.
Proven experience designing scalable, global solutions for high-growth or enterprise organizations.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to translate complex data into meaningful insights.
Demonstrated success leading cross-functional projects and managing multiple priorities.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact at all organizational levels.
Highly organized, intellectually curious, self-motivated, and proactive in driving outcomes.
Experience with ATS platforms (e.g., Greenhouse), internal integrations, and data architecture is a plus.
Knowledge of industry trends in HR tech and interest in applying AI-driven or automation solutions a plus.

Title: Sr. Category Associate, EU
